SUBMISSION OF “PRE-EXAMINATION FACULTY FEEDBACK” BY THE STUDENTS OF 4TH, 6TH, 8TH AND 10TH SEMESTERS
  • 08 Apr 2022
  • ONLINE SUBMISSION OF “PRE-EXAMINATION FACULTY FEEDBACK” AND “STUDENT HANDBOOK DECLARATION FORM” BY THE STUDENTS OF 4TH, 6TH, 8TH AND 10TH SEMESTERS OF AUUP NOIDA, LUCKNOW AND GREATER NOIDA CAMPUSES W.R.T. EVEN SEMESTER, ACADEMIC SESSION 2021-2022
    • View
    FREE YOGA COURSES
  • 04 Apr 2022
  • FREE YOGA COURSES Association of Indian Universities (AIU) has partnered with the eminent Yoga organizations and experts for 100 day- Yoga for Unity and Well Being 2022 event being organised globally from 20 March to 22 Jun 2022. The event is also promoted by the Ministry of Ayush, Government of India. The event is aimed to connect Mind, Body and Soul through Yoga practices and bring in happiness and wellbeing among participants. The event is organised at global level and the participants shall be able to enroll for free on the link www.yoga4unity.com in one or more of the 5 courses viz Master Classes, Yoga 4 Beginners, Yoga 4 Seniors, Yoga 4 Yoga Teachers, Yoga 4 Kids The session in the courses shall be conducted by renowned personalities like Swami Ramdev, Patanjali, Shri Kamlesh D.Patel (Daaji), Heartfulness, Dr Chinmay Pandya, Saraswati Vasudevasn, Subodh Tiwari, Dr Vijay Kumar etc. The last date of registration is 15th April, 2022. The participants who register till 15th April, 2022 shall receive a Certificate of Participation after 21 June, 2022.
    • View

    FORMAT--INDEMNITY BOND [ONLY FOR THOSE STUDENTS, WHO HAVEN'T SUBMITTED ORIGINAL SIGNED COPY TO INST]
  • 01 Feb 2022
  • FORMAT OF INDEMNITY BOND [ONLY FOR THOSE STUDENTS, WHO HAVE NOT SUBMITTED ORIGINAL DULY SIGNED INDEMNITY BOND TO THEIR INSTITUTIONS] Students with their Parents were informed well in advance through emails as well as Amizone at the time of their Pre-approval and Registration into 1st Semester/1st Year that duly Notarized Indemnity Bond signed by Parent/Guardian (Whichever applicable) on Rs.100/- Non-Judicial Stamp Paper will be submitted in Original on the day of physical reporting of the students at the University, presently, please accept its online declaration on Amizone under Profile Entry Form by ticking (v) in checkbox given on Amizone. Such students are advised to submit the ORIGINAL INDEMNITY BOND, ON RS.100/- NON-JUDICIAL STAMP PAPER, DULY SIGNED BY PARENT/GUARDIAN to their institutions at the earliest.
    • View
    Notice for Not Reported/Not Re-registered Students of 4th,6th,8th and 10th Sem in Even Sem AY21-22
  • 10 Jan 2022
  • Notice for Not Reported/ Not Re-registered Students of 4th, 6th, 8th and 10th Semesters w.r.t. Even Sem Academic Session 2021-22 --> Complete your Re-registration process immediately Date: 10.01.2022 Dear Students, You have not re-registered for your Even semester 2021-22, this may lead to loss of your academic learning and will affect your attendance and associated marks of courses during the semester. As you know that “A student whose attendance is below than the required attendance as per University Policy/relevant Regulatory Body, whichever is higher, whatever may be the reason for shortfall will not be permitted to appear in the End Semester Examination of course(s).” Your Academic Planning Worksheet (APW) must be submitted by you and approved by your Programme Leader / HoI on time. If APW is not approved, your attendance will not be marked even if you attend your classes. You are advised to speak to your Programme Leader / HoI, if there is any issue in completing the re-registration process and APW approval. Best Wishes, Prof. (Dr.) Alpana Kakkar Dean Student Support & Academic Affairs E-mail: studentsupport@amity.edu

    President Message

    Dear Students,

    Over the last many weeks we have sadly come to know of some of our students losing a parent or both to Covid-19 complications. Though we have been doing all we can to give them emotional support, we have now decided to go a step further.

    If any current student at Amity University UP loses a parent that was supporting their fees for education and is facing financial difficulties because of that, we will sponsor the remaining full academic fees till they complete their current degree at Amity University UP.

    If you know of any of your fellow students who needs this help, please inform the Dean Student Welfare at dsw@amity.edu who will assess each individual case.

    In these times of stress and anxiety, it is also very important to take care of your mental health. As you know, our professional Amity Counsellors and Psychologists are available 24 hours a day for you. Do use this service any time you need by calling 18001026489.

    Wishing you good health.

    All the best.

    Atul Chauhan
    Chancellor, Amity University
    President, Ritnand Balved Education Foundation
    CEO, AKC Group of Companies
